snippet: In another indication that employment is picking up, Americans took 200 million more rides last year on subways, trains, light rail and buses than they did the year before.
abstract: Report by the American Public Transportation Association finds that more Americans used public transportation in 2011, an indication that many of them have returned to the workforce; finds that in total, Americans took 10.4 billion rides on public transportation.
lead_paragraph: In another indication that employment is picking up, Americans took 200 million more rides last year on subways, trains, light rail and buses than they did the year before.

headline.seo: Use of Public Transit Rose in 2011, Report Says
headline.main: Use of Public Transit Grew in 2011, Report Indicates
headline.print_headline: Use of Public Transit Grew In 2011, Report Indicates
